Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2008 08:43PM onwardandforward wrote: The glaucoma drug that causes lash growth is called lumigan.  Allergan is starting clinical trials to get FDA approval for lash growth (was in the Wall Street Journal a month ago or so).  A doc can give you an rx for lumigan, but beware that it hasn't really been tested yet in healthy eyes (without glaucoma) and there are possible side effects (blue iris for one).  A cosmetic company was selling a product that contained a similar active ingredient, but Allergan sued them and it was taken off the market (it's since come back with a completely different ingredient and unclear if it even works). For eyebrow growth, you can try Rogaine applied with a q-tip.  Takes a few months to see if it works and if it does you just keep up with it....

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 10:28AM onwardandforward wrote: Kris 60 -- Ask your onco for a referral to a good anesthesia pain management doctor.  There are lots of meds that can be helpful for pain during and post-chemo.  Have you tried Lyrica?  They use it for chemo-induced neuropathy and it also helps with muscle pain. It's a drug that is now being advertised for fibromyalgia pain and is also used for pain after shingles.  Might be worth asking your doctor about it.
